title: @RiotRepertoir Can we rework Fiddlesticks' passive?
body: Lets face it, Fiddlesticks' passive is in a weak spot right now and with the release of every new champion his seems worse and worse. Do you think it will change in the future? Maybe a passive that works well with his fear. If a champion is turned away from him then "blah blah blah" happens? Just an idea.

replies.body: Hopefully they make it exciting. Right now it's kind of bland.

Yeah, this is really the main problem I see. It lacks in excitement much more than power. As much as you guys don't like true damage, I'd think we should just do something like "Fiddlesticks' spells deal true damage to feared enemies" or something else that gives instant, clear feedback as to the power his passive has. Do note that's probably not a balanced idea and not something I've fully thought through, but something that either has more gameplay or more visceral impact would definitely serve him well.

I think Fiddles as a whole needs reworked. He has gotten every ability nerfed multiple times. He is in a current state where he has the highest average games played by his playerbase, yet still is in the lower part of junglers. Not too mention his laning was completely rekt. But he can't be strong because people that don't ward complain about him. I'd rather have him reworked than in a perpetual state of low tier just because the vast majority of players are low elo, myself included, and don't know how to play against him. Just my two cents worth.

As someone who has been playing Fiddle since Season 1, the idea of him getting reworked by the current update staff is absolutely terrifying. I don't want to see another Karma/Trundle/Cassi, where big chunks of what makes the champion interesting are outright deleted with neither warning nor followup. I don't want to see him get the GP/Morde/Skarn treatment, either, forced to play around a new gimmick while his original playstyle and fantasy is somewhat ditched.

If Riot talked to us about a rework before it went through to Live, that'd be nice, but lately we've been getting more shock reveals from updates than from lore, and that's scary.

First off, there aren't any plans that I'm aware of to do a big update to Fiddlesticks, so you don't have to worry about that :)

The only real spell he has that is unsatisfying to Fiddle and/or unclear to the enemy is his Passive, so if anything, we may just try to take small wins we could get on that front to make it more interesting/satisfying for all parties.

Since you mentioned it a bit, though... What does make the champion interesting to you?

You...just made me think of something.  What if the point of the passive was so that it WASN'T clear?  What if the passive prevented the enemy from seeing Fiddle's health?  Fiddles to me is Terror incarnate, and what's more terrifying than the unknown? Is my damage stronger than his heal? Am I actually killing him? Maybe I should run away! I SHOULD RUN AWAY! (Fiddles lives with 45 health)

I figured there weren't plans; was mostly just responding to LaceUp23's idea.

When I first started playing in S1, I played him because he had a silence, fear, and a drain. I love CC-focused mages, always drawn to things like cryomancers and mezzers, and drain tanking is a super cool playstyle that isn't always well-balanced. So, being able to heavily disrupt the enemy team while keeping myself alive through careful in-fight decisions just felt awesome.

To put it in easier terms: situational disruption, situational survivability, situational damage, some ability to create/exploit opportunities to use his tools.

Thematically, he's just *weird*. Like, a goofy scarecrow that lives in a closet and might be the harbinger of a witch army? Bonkers. Doesn't fit in the more grimdark/straightforward narrative environment Riot has chosen, though, but I'm confident he can and should remain unsettling and difficult to understand.

Things I'd like to see him keep in a rework: Some option to cause fear as CC, a presence that causes tension when he's not visible, built-in drain/spellvamp, focus on engaging and managing fights. I like him as a mix of "tank" and "assassin" design qualities.

i really want to know what do you think of his old E? damage 100 all ranks, bouces: 2/4/6/8/10 silence 1.4 seconds which it isn't refresher unlike the old one

I rather liked the old Dark Wind before it was reworked so it stopped prioritizing champions (RIP {{champion:9}} easy ARAM kills on the backline) it's not really as easy to bounce anymore (if anyone is even capable of predicting it anymore) but I think the need to remove the refreshing silence was warranted.

What makes fiddlesticks more interesting than most other champions is his sustain in the jungle. While I do buy 2 health pots at the start of the game, I tend to not need any more pots for the rest. His drain skill is fun to use but using it at the right timing in a fight is always critical especially if they have CC. 

Since fiddlesticks is so fragile to CC maybe we can make a passive that reacts to CC in a way? Just a thought, but maybe if he is CC'ed his damage output is increased by X percent. Or if he is CC'ed then he gains X amount of magic resist and armor. I know this doesn't add to his kit in a whole, especially his jungling but it could add interesting team-fights. I do like the true damage idea while they are feared but of course tests will have to be done to see how that works out.

His ult is also a huge game changer mid/end game and if he snow balls it is fun to ult + Zhonyas into their team. 

However, right now he is a lower tier jungler and I believe a passive update might help bring more players to pick him up.

To be honest, it's not like he can really get worse from where he stands now. He's gotten nerfed out of play anyway. While the current update team is pretty meh, there is always that chance that we could get a Sion outta it lol...and that chance is worth taking in my opinion. Plus, maybe CertainlyT will rework him and he will get 3 dashes, an aoe stun, %health damage, and still crazy high numbers :D

Ugh, no. Making a champion strong but unsatisfying and calling the rework successful is just awful. Cassi was numerically bonkers good, but her rework was still a horrific mess. I'd rather have a Fiddle that satisfies a fantasy than one that introduces new minigames or OP options to the LCS.

I must add to two other things, too.

Slight adjustment to Fiddle's ult:

> **Crowstorm [R]**
> Change Fiddlestick's ultimate to _**tail behind**_ and _**flail around**_, finding _**its way to centre**_ of Fiddletstick's as he moves and teleports. I ask of this to make Fiddlestick's AOE burst-Flash craziness less f***ing stupid. Currently it's just stuck on his centre wherever he goes. Important that it's kept terrifying, though.

Synergize with his "SURPRISE" aspect? Give him a large burst of extra AP if he damages an enemy with a spell 3 seconds after he reveals himself. Amplify his "SURPRISE" gameplay, while weakening him in extended fights.

EDIT: Kinda like an AP version of Kha'Zix passive, with a 30 second or so cooldown and lasting for 5 seconds or so?
